author: felixweber
title: Ledger Developer Onboarding Course
description: Ledger devices can increase the security of Cardano users and projects (through integrations). We want to make it easy for dApps and integrations to add Ledger support to their products.

f6_assessments.q0: Ledger and Trezor are the most popular hardware wallets. Hardware wallet improves security and they are recommended for any high-value wallets. The issue with these wallets is they need to integrate with the dApps in a hardware-specific way. Gimballabs have been pioneers in Project Based Learning(PBL) in Cardano which is a very practical way and has contributed immensely to the availability of Plutus and Cardano-trained developers to the ecosystem. The proposal is a great combination to develop software with utility and also train people in the niche technology of hardware wallet integration. The proposal is to train people to develop and integrate their dApps and products with Ledger, over three quarters in 2022. The course output is expected to be open source therefore the reach of the material is likely to be wider than the initial cohort. Therefore I feel that the project is very much in alignment with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team from Ledger and Gimbalabs have partnered with “bridge builders” for delivering the project. Ledger is a very reputed brand in the world of Crypto and I have personally seen outstanding work of similar nature from Gimbalabs in the last two years. They have demonstrated the commitment and the quality of the work to the community in these nascent years of Cardano. Therefore I have a firm belief that the proposal is in one of the best hands possible to achieve the aim.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is to prepare 6 modules for training on Ledger integration over three quarters. The cost quoted is $2500 for developing one module and $2500 for coordinating and conducting the training with experts from Ledger. An additional amount of $10K has been included for overall project management and proposal stewardship. ($10,000 for 4 months of proposal stewardship). The project deliverables are quite clear and well-defined. There can be questions on the amount of money for each module. However, I feel Ledger Hardware integration is an involved technology and resources with state of art knowledge in programming will be required to create content in this field. Therefore these amounts are quite reasonable 9 months of high technology effort to prepare opensource training material on an important aspect of the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a project-based learning course about integrating with Ledger devices and Ledger Live, which will be created and run by Ledger, Gimbalabs, and Bridge Builders. The proposal is a great fit for the challenge as it will promote integrations with Ledger, which will also increase the security of the Cardano ecosystem. Furthermore, the reach of the 3 organization will certainly attract new developers to Cardano, spur conversations, create connections and possible new projects, which will likely be open-source as they will be building on top of the open-source material of the course. The proposers also realize challenges and risks that might affect the impact of their proposal and have good measures in place to react and maximize impact. All the above are clearly and thoughtfully described in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: According to all the information provided I believe that this proposal is highly likely to be implemented successfully. Well known and capable people (in total 6) from the 3 organizations will be in charge of the project. Several of the people involved have organized similar courses in the past and have received funding for Project Catalyst to do so. There exists a detailed timetable with actionable items and a very detailed and reasonable budgeting structure for each phase of the project. The course will run for in Q4 but set up and pilot course will start as early Q3! Finally, the proposers have identified 3 main risks and clearly present their mitigation plans.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is very likely to be easily and efficiently audited. The proposers define the metrics that will determine the success of the proposal. These span across students' achievements in the course but also implementation of the needed systems in order for the course to run smoothly. The team also plans to submit monthly progress reports to IOG, which would also improve community auditability if made public (it's not clear if these reports will be presented in Catalalyst's Townhall). Proposal success is also clearly defined, i.e., at least 10 developers are onboarded and educated, who will be the core of a new vibrant community around ledger integrations.

f6_assessments.q0: It is not a mystery that many users are unfamiliar with Cold wallets. In this case, Ledger is possibly a name that people have heard about. But there are not a lot of people who currently use this wallet. It can be extremely useful for certain investors. Especially those that have the strategy to buy and hold long-term. It is one of the safest options to store your crypto and gives you complete control. The idea of this proposal is to create a project-based learning course where they will be educated on how to create ledger live integrations and enable ledger for their own use. This could have a positive outcome for the Cardano community because it promotes security. This can decrease the number of newer users who get caught up in various unfortunate events. This increases trust in the Crypto industry and in this case, will specifically increase trust in Cardano and it's blockchain. A learning program for this would be important because most people still don't know how this works. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: It is important to note that in this proposal, it includes the team members that are working on this project. When considering the principle of feasibility, this will help allow the readers of this proposal to verify the team members and provide a feasible approach to auditing. The team at Gimbalabs has already successfully implemented other proposals and has a functioning product. This helps suggest that the team can be trusted, and that the proposal will likely be implemented successfully. However, there is still more information to consider. The proposal includes a roadmap that includes specific details in regards to how the team plans to implement the ledger developer onboarding course. They have taken time into consideration and have provided a specific timeframe of completion. This will take place throughout the rest of the year. There are specific details that share what the team plans on completing throughout the year during Q2,Q3, and Q4. This is important to note because it will allow for the principle of accountability to help ensure that the team reaches these milestones that have been set in their roadmap. There is also a detailed budget breakdown that provides details on exactly where the requested funds would be allocated. This helps the readers of this proposal to visualize how this is going to look and will make sure that the team utilizes these funds properly. The team needs to make sure that there is a community following this project so that there can be more engagement. This would be the next biggest step to determine the likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided in this proposal is stated in a way that can be understood simply. It is concise but includes a lot of important information. The team provides their linkedin profiles and there are specific details as described in the section above with their roadmap and budget breakdown. These are some great indicators that helps allow the auditing process of potential success of this proposal. There are a couple of concepts that may suggest an even more successful route for the project. The first idea is transparency. The team at Gimbalabs and ledger should be completely open with their community of this proposal. If the team hasn't provided this information yet, this could help the auditing process. This is because it allows trust to be built within the community members. Once there is trust, there can be a great deal of accountability that will influence the project positively. In this case, the community will help the team reach their milestones as suggested in their roadmap and promote hard work to get the onboarding course out in public. It will ensure that the project will be released near Q4 of the year. This is a project that can be very successful and will help the overall security of users in the Cardano space. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 4 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: Security is key in a technology Advancing age of the blockchain. Many participants in Cardano DEFI space are not comfortable interacting with many projects because the wallet supported by the project is not as secure as they believed, they prefer to navigate using a hardware wallet and it is not readily available for many projects due to integration hurdles. These proposer intends to build an opens source Project Based Learning course to take developers (hands on) to learn how to integrate ledger devices on their products.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is sufficient information with (verifiable) links that nicely add up to the proposed idea as well as what has been implemented. The timelines are well structured and project is going to work in synergy with Gimbalabs and some team members from ledger to create rich course contents on both project management structures down to executing ledger PBL programs. 
The budget and the requested budget amount is fair and reasonable, there was proper breakdown of all items that shows a fair expenditure. Lastly, there's sufficient information about team with expertise that are relevant to the proposed idea (links verified). All these combined gives me much confidence in the team and i believe it is very likely that the project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and timeline provided is clear and concise availing me some key deliverables for each stage of the project which i believe is a great tool to measure and track progress. Project will also keep track of some information like number of development canvases, courses created/developers onboarded, live integrations by projects etc. The KPI used to evaluate success is reasonable and well chosen and unique.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer identifies a long-standing problem within our ecosystem: the slowness with which our dapps adapt their functionality to hard wallets. And the proposed solution is quite satisfactory since it integrates members of recognized trajectory from both communities (in this case Ledger and Cardano) and proposes to teach a course to educate the developers of our community to carry out this task of greater interconnectivity.
 
If successful, this proposal will bring immeasurable value to our community. Since it will allow all Cardan Dapps users to add another layer of security when putting their assets to work in different smart contracts.
 
Finally, this proposal is well aligned with the objectives of this challenge.
 
For these three rationales, I see no reason to deduct any point in this category, so the Impact score is the maximum.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is the category in which this proposal shines. Since I can think of no more qualified people to carry out this endeavor than the same members of the Ledger team and the members of Gimbalabs and Bridge Builders who have already repeatedly demonstrated their commitment to construction within our community.
 
The proposers provide the links that show the members as suitable to carry out the venture.
 
On the other hand, they offer a well balanced budget and a clear and realistic timetable (which shows seriousness in their objective). The budget, on the other hand, is not excessive and seems fair for the challenges of this proposal.
 
The team also elaborated on the various risks they are exposed to and have responded to each of them convincingly.
 
For all these reasons, it becomes clear to me that the maximum score is the one that also corresponds to the feasibility category.
f6_assessments.q2:
The goals of this proposal are conservative. That speaks of the seriousness of the project. The proposers delimit a roadmap with milestones and also list the kpis that will serve the community to carry out the auditability of this project.
 
The only flaw I see in the entire project is not explicitly making clear the channels through which the community can see the progress of this course. However, I don't think it's such a serious problem for this project in particular, since if this proposal is successful, the results will be visible when the developers begin to integrate Ledger into their products.

f6_assessments.q0: How can your proposal be sketchy like this? Honestly, the description of your proposed solution is extremely meager and short. Where’s your project’s main functions? What about your key products? Who is your project aiming at? What impacts are they going to get? None of this information is included in your proposal. In the second part of this Impact section, you mentioned that “This proposal will encourage the further adoption of Cardano DID.” This key metric is aligned with that of the challenge, I admit that completely. But I don’t think this statement is convincing enough because of your lack of evidence.Please say more about your results relevant to the challenge after proceeding with the project to persuade the voters. In terms of the risks, can’t you anticipate some certain challenges your project might confront in the future? Your answer “As with any project, there is a risk that not many people may warm up to the idea but I believe that it is a quirky idea well worth exploring.” is extremely general. I suggest you try to think about this problem as well as finding the key for risk reduction.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan in your proposal is clearly written and concise. In every quarter of the year 2022, you manage to show many activities/milestones that should be reached. But here I have a suggestion for you: “detailize” the timeline by setting a certain month when your milestone will be reached. If you can do so, it’ll be likely to make a good impression for the voters and community since they will think that your team is very serious in this challenge and deserves support. The requested fund is reasonable for this challenge, and how it will be allocated by your team is explained coherently. This appears to be the most detailed and transparent budget breakdown that I have seen. Oppositely, I don’t want to say something like this but you disappoint me a bit when reading your list of team members. I know people can tap into these attached LinkedIn links in this section to find out more about your staff. But can you describe more about their profiles in this proposal? For example, when it comes to Gimbalabs, James Dunseith is co-founder there, but you should mention his relevant achievements, degrees, talents and working years. And you should tell the same in terms of other staff, too. I wish you can fix these problems so that this Feasibility section will become perfect.
f6_assessments.q2: I don’t think your content about measurement for tracking is sufficient enough. Indisputably, all the listed factors that can be tracked are clear-cut; however, where they can be kept track of is hidden. Such as, where will the number of development of Canvas PBL modules, developers enrolled in cohort #1 of the Cardano Ledger PBL, Ledger PBL Canvas modules completed by students be shown? Let the community know in order to follow the working progress easily. Furthermore, the specificity of your project success is easy to figure out. You are able to give the statement that your project will be called successful if 10 developers are onboarded and educated through the Ledger PBL course through Q4 2022. It’s kinda persuasive when you can give out a specific number like that. But if you can add more information to this part, I think your project will have more chances to be funded.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has presented a phenomenal proposal, but has placed it in the wrong challenge category. The idea behind this proposal is HIGHLY needed in the Cardano ecosystem, but the proposal is not based on Dapps, Products & Integration. 

Rather, this proposal is based on an onboarding course for the developer ecosystem and should have been placed in the  "Developer Ecosystem" challenge category. The proposer should consider more carefully what challenge category they chose for their proposal in any future proposal that they bring forth.
f6_assessments.q1:
With a combination of Ledger, Gimbalabs, and Bridge Builders coming together to create a project-based learning course for developers, it is very promising that there will be success with this proposal. With the followings of these companies alone, along with  marketing within the developer communities of Cardano, it is highly likely that this proposal will have successful implementation, and is needed because Ledger Live integrations and having products enable Ledger will bring all the more security to the blockchain as well as enabling the end user to keep true control  over their ADA.

The timeline as well as the key milestones listed, and the members of the team and participating companies ( Ledger, Gimbalabs, and Bridge Builders) would amount to being implemented successfully. 

The proposer has also considered the risks as well as ways to mitigate those risk should they arise making even clearer that this proposal has a very high likelihood of being successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
With the detailed break down that this proposal presents us with, there is more then sufficient ability to audit the progress  and success of this proposal. Here is what the proposer put down:
 - Number of development of Canvas PBL modules

- Number of developers enrolled in cohort #1 of the Cardano Ledger PBL

- Number of Ledger PBL Canvas modules completed by students

- Show case of completed integrations with Ledger Live by Cardano projects

- Implementing Treasury & Accounting systems ( Treasury Guild ) 

- Implementing Dework & Discord Integrations for project management

- Implementing Gimbal token - contribution tracker to recognize students thru their PBL

With each of these it is easy to track the progress of the proposal after it has received the funding it needs.

They success of the proposal would be easily seen in the number of developers signing up for and participating in the Ledger PBL course. Furthermore we would begin to see the outcome of this course with the integration of ledger support any many products in the Cardano ecosystem as they begin to implement what they have learned.

solution: Create a Project-based Learning (PBL) course to take developers through a hands-on project to learn how to create Ledger Live integrations and enable Ledger devices on their products.
experience: This is a joint proposal between Ledger (the creators of the hardware and Ledger Live environment), Gimbalabs championing the PBL model for education, and Bridge Builders connecting the community and Catalyst to this initiative.
